root: ^This is odd, I have never seen someones record like this, it says that they are not from this planet..
^Have a talk with them and see what this is all about.

c-0: ^Then yes, to you I am an alien.
c-2: ^Now that I think of it, I don't really know.

c-0: ^Well, first you will need to tell me where here is.

c-1: ^What is heaven? Is this an estate agents or something?
^No, It's the place you go to when you die.
^I died? I thought that when I died I would go to "forever-rest" and welcomed by my ancestors, why am I speaking to a human?
c-2: ^We have captured you and you are in a simulation.
^You are lying to me Human, my body readings tell me that both my hearts had a critical failure which means I reached the end of my lifespan.
^I am supposed to be welcomed by my ancestors when I die, why am I talking to a Human?

s: ^To be honest we are just as confused as you are...

c-1: ^I had a heart attack just as I was flying by your planet, since I was within your planets sphere of influence, I think I was sent here instead of seeing my ancestors back home.
c-2: ^you call us humans so you must know of us, atleast.
^Yes, I was flying by earth when I had the heart attack.
^Then this must mean that because you were closer to my planet than yours, you must have been sent here by accident.

g-1: ^Is there any way for you to bring me back as this is obviously a mistake?

second: ^This is the first time this has happened

c-0: ^I don't think there is anything I can do for you.
^So I'm just stuck here then? What am I supposed to do now?
^The next step is for me to decide if you are allowed into heaven or not.
c-1: ^This is the first time this has happened to us, there is no protocol.
^Well there aren't many life forms that visit this planet and when they do the stay is short as the food here is just terrible.
^Ah, so you don't like the steak...
^Well I am going to need to decide if you are allowed into heaven or not.
g-0: ^Well since this is obviously a mistake then you can just let me in right?
^First off I'm going to need to understand you a bit better.

third: ^Actually I'm sorry for interrupting, but in these circumstances I am able to give you permission to bring him back to life.
^When were you going to tell me about this?
^It never came up... anyway I took the liberty of changing your red button so instead of sending him to hell it will bring him back to life. Do not take this power lightly!
^You don't even want to know what happened last time we brought someone back to life, the humanities department spent an entire month cleaning up that mess.
^Okay thank you, I will be very carful about my decision.
^Please bring me back to life, this is a mistake and I need to get back home.
^Just hold on a minute, as she said... this is a serious decision and I think I need to know a little more about you first.
fourth: ^So why did you come to earth?
^I own a fast food franchise, we serve fast food on planets all over the galaxy.
^Currently I am looking to branch out and open a new restaurant in this quadrant of the galaxy and your planet seems to be a great candidate.
^We will be able to serve you humans at such a low cost that we could turn a profit in under a year.

c-0: ^You can't just turn up to a planet and open a restaurant if you feel like it! You need to contact the correct authorities and request planning permission and all sorts.
^Actually I have done, the Inter Galactic Federation of Fast Food Services have granted me full permission to use your planet.
^Oh well I guess I can't argue with that.
c-1: ^Why open a restaurant here? If anything we have too many fast food companies I doubt you would turn a profit with the competition.
^Actually I won't be competing with any of your companies as we won't be serving to humans.
^So you will be bringing more aliens with you? It's too crowded here already, we are running out of space.
^With each alien that comes to earth there will be a human going with them, I think it's favourable for both of us.
c-2: ^So what food do aliens eat? What would you be serving?
^My restaurant serve economical proteins, at a cheap price to low income families across the galaxy.
^Human meat tends to be an affordable meat that is high in unsaturated fat and a good source of vitamin B12.
^You are planning on serving humans? All this time I thought you were opening a restaurant to serve food to humans, not eat us!!
^it's not like I'm trying to hide this from you.

fifth: ^I'll bring you back if you leave Earth
^Can I just send you to hell?

c-0: ^If I bring you back to life you need to promise me that you will take this development elsewhere.
^Why should I? I will be doing both of us a favour by opening this restaurant.
^How on earth would this be doing me a favour?
^Because I will deal with your population problem.
^You can't eat innocent people, and if you did there would be even more people flooding into my office and we don't have the room.
c-1: ^Can I just send you to hell? It seems like the easier option.
^Actually I already changed your button once and I'm not doing it again.
^Well thanks a lot! You are a load of help.
c-2: ^So if I didn't bring you back to life, is there any chance that someone else would come along and open another similar restaurant?
^Most likely one of my competitors will come along, the human meat is so affordable and low quality it's hard to pass on the money making opportunity.

global decl: ^Well done, now he won't be able to turn earth into a farm and hopefully if he gets hungry in heaven he can sort out our overpopulation issue.
^Good Job, you have doomed the entire human race, I hope you are ready for the constant stream of people coming in, all of which have you to blame.
